questions.question: What does the Pigeonhole Principle state?
options: If n items are put into m containers, with n > m, then at least one container must contain more than one item
If n items are put into m containers, with n < m, then at least one container must contain more than one item
If n items are put into m containers, with n > m, then at least one container must be empty
If n items are put into m containers, with n = m, then each container must contain exactly one item
questions.correct_answer: If n items are put into m containers, with n > m, then at least one container must contain more than one item

questions.question: What is the formula for the nth term of the Fibonacci sequence, also known as Binet's formula?
Which theorem states that every natural number greater than 1 is either a prime number, or can be written as a unique product of prime numbers?
In graph theory, what term is used to refer to a walk in which all the graph edges and vertices are distinct?
In number theory, what is the name for a positive integer n that divides evenly into 2^n - 2?
What is the generating function for the sequence of Fibonacci numbers?
What is the primary use of the Chinese Remainder Theorem?
options: Finding the greatest common divisor of two integers

questions.question: In a Boolean algebra, what do you call an element 'a' such that 'a AND a' equals 'a'?
If a graph has a Hamiltonian cycle, which theorem guarantees that the graph has a Hamiltonian path as well?
What is the maximum number of edges in a simple undirected graph with 'n' vertices?
